vision.notes: Most species have moveable eyelids but lack lacrimal glands. Many species display bright and contrasting colors for aposematism.

chemoreception.notes: Many species-specific courtship rituals employ pheromones to induce mating behavior in females. Pheromones have been discovered to be the driving force behind female mating responses in Alpine newts.

mechanoreception.notes: Possess four well-developed limbs with toes. They lack rib or costal grooves along the sides of their bodies.

nociception.notes: Nearly all salamandrids produce a potent toxin in their skin, with some species being deadly to many other animal species, indicating a sensitivity to harmful stimuli. Their skin is very granular because of the number of poison glands.
